greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: E.g.f.: arcsin(x).
comment: A001818 interspersed with zeros. - _Joerg Arndt_, Aug 31 2013

a(n) is the number of permutations of n-1 where all cycles have even length.  For example, a(5)=9 and the permutations of 4 elements with only even cycles are (1,2)(3,4); (1,3)(2,4); (1,4)(2,3); (1,2,3,4); (1,2,4,3); (1,3,2,4); (1,3,4,2); (1,4,2,3); (1,4,3,2).
a(n) is the number of permutations on n - 1 elements where there are no cycles of even length and an even number of cycles of odd length. - _N. Sato_, Aug 29 2013
reference: L. Comtet and M. Fiolet, Sur les dérivées successives d'une fonction implicite. C. R. Acad. Sci. Paris Ser. A 278 (1974), 249-251.
link: Michael Wallner, A bijection of plane increasing trees with relaxed binary trees of right height at most one, arXiv:1706.07163 [math.CO], 2017, p. 12.
formula: G.f.: Q(0)*x^2/(1+x) + x/(1+x), where Q(k) = 1 + (2*k + 1)^2 * x * (1 + x * Q(k+1));  - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, May 10 2013 [Edited by _Michael Somos_, Oct 07 2013]
E.g.f of a(n + 1), n >= 0, is 1/sqrt(1 - x^2). - _N. Sato_, Aug 29 2013
If n is odd, a(n) ~ 2*n^(n-1) / exp(n). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Oct 05 2013
E.g.f.: arcsin(x) = x + x^3/(T(0)-x^2), where T(k) = 4*k^2*(1+x^2) + 2*k*(5+2*x^2) +6 + x^2 - 2*x^2*(k+1)*(2*k+3)^3/T(k+1) ; (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Nov 13 2013
example: 1 is in the sequence because, for k=1, f'(x) = 1/sqrt(1-x^2), and f'(0) = 1.
maple: n0:= 30: T:=array(1..n0+1): f:=x->arcsin(x):for n from 1 to n0 do:T[n]:=(D(f)(0)):f:=D(f):od: print(T):
mathematica: a[ n_] := If[ n < 1, 0, If[ EvenQ[n], 0, (n - 2)!!^2]]; (* _Michael Somos_, Oct 07 2013 *)
a[ n_] := If[ n < 0, 0, n! SeriesCoefficient[ ArcSin[x], {x, 0, n}]]; (* _Michael Somos_, Oct 07 2013 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<2, n==1, (n-2)^2 * a(n-2))}; /* _Michael Somos_, Oct 07 2013 */
(PARI) a(n) = if( n<0, 0, n! * polcoeff( asin(x + x * O(x^n)), n)); /* _Michael Somos_, Oct 07 2013 */
xref: Alternate terms are A001818. - _N. Sato_, May 13 2010
results.author: _Michel Lagneau_, May 03 2010
